statement.p:
[Cleary] A farmer with 1200 acres is considering planting three different crops, corn, soybeans, and oats. The farmer wants to use all 1200 acres. Seed corn costs 20 per acre, while soybean and oat seed cost 50 and 12 per acre respectively. The farmer has 40\,000 available to buy seed and intends to spend it all.
Use the information above to formulate two linear equations with three unknowns and solve it.
Solutions to the system are choices that the farmer can make. Write down two solutions.
Suppose that in the fall when the crops mature, the farmer can bring in revenue of 100 per acre for corn, 300 per acre for soybeans and 180per acre for oats. Which of your two solutions in the prior part would have resulted in a larger revenue?

ol.li: There are many answers possible here. For instance we can take a=0 to get c=\frac{20000}{30}\approx 666.66 and s=\frac{16000}{30}\approx 533.33. Another example is to take a=\frac{20000}{38}\approx 526.32, giving c=0 and s=\frac{7360}{38}\approx 193.68.
Plug your answers from the prior part into 100c+300s+80a.

statement.p: Parametrize the solution set of this one-equation system. x_1+x_2+\cdots+x_n=0

answer.p: This system has one equation. The leading variable is x_1, the other variables are free. We thus obtain the solution set \bigl\{\vec{-1 1 \vdots, -1 0}x_2 + \cdots + \vec{-1 0 \vdots, -1 1}x_n \mid x_2, \ldots, x_n \text{ in } \R \bigr\}
